35232142: Flooding in Newton Stewart, Hawick, and Peebles has caused widespread damage, with repair work ongoing and a flood alert remaining in place across the Borders due to constant rain.
40143035: A fire alarm went off at a Holiday Inn in Northern Ireland, engulfing two tour buses parked outside, destroying personal belongings and forcing passengers from Germany and China/Taiwan to leave without their belongings.
35951548: Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton secured pole position at the Bahrain Grand Prix, beating teammate Nico Rosberg by 0.077 seconds, while Ferrari's Sebastian Vettel finished third ahead of teammate Kimi Raikkonen.
36266422: John Edward Bates, a 67-year-old former scout leader, faces 22 charges of indecency with children, including allegations of sexual abuse by four male complainants between 1972 and 1989.
38826984: A man receiving psychiatric treatment at Cerahpasa hospital threatened to shoot himself and others, prompting an evacuation and police negotiation efforts.
34540833: Glasgow Warriors defeated Dragons 23-17 in a messy match, with Simone Favaro scoring the crucial try and Rory Clegg converting it to seal the win.
20836172: A woman, Veronica Vanessa Chango-Alverez, was killed and another man injured when an Audi A3 struck them in Streatham High Road, London, on Saturday morning.
35932467: Belgian cyclist Antoine Demoitie, 25, died after colliding with a motorbike during the Gent-Wevelgem race, sparking calls for improved safety measures to prevent similar incidents.
40758845: Ilkay Gundogan is recovering from a cruciate knee ligament injury and aims to return to Manchester City's lineup in weeks rather than months, but will not rush his comeback.
30358490: A man in his 20s suffered a head injury and suspected fractures after a crash on the A127 in Leigh-on-Sea, Essex, and was airlifted to hospital for further treatment.
34615665: A tropical storm has made landfall in Mexico, earning its highest rating since 1959, marking a significant weather event for the region.
35890902: Weaknesses in wireless mouse signals left them vulnerable to spoofing attacks, allowing attackers to control computers remotely by sending fake keystrokes over unencrypted radio signals.
37922330: Murray and Burrell, a Galashiels-based building firm established in 1928, went into administration due to adverse trading conditions, resulting in the redundancy of 38 staff members.
30844962: The European Commission has launched an investigation into Amazon's tax arrangement with Luxembourg, citing concerns that it may have received special treatment and potentially broken EU rules.
36217333: The Balmoral Show, a three-day agricultural event in Northern Ireland, celebrates farming, food, and family fun with local produce, livestock displays, and interactive activities for visitors of all ages.
30816523: Max Mosley is suing Google for breaching his privacy by hosting photos of him at a sex party, despite winning damages from News of the World in 2008 over similar allegations.
38900884: Eddie Jackson, a 28-year-old Bath-born player, will miss several games for Dragons due to injury, leaving a void that others can fill.
13890581: A three-year funding package has been announced for the Cornish Language Partnership, ensuring the survival of the critically endangered language and paving the way for long-term support from Cornwall itself.
40194700: Monaco's manager Leonardo Jardim described his three-year tenure as "exceptional", leading the team to a French championship and Champions League semi-finals before rejecting offers from elsewhere to continue at the club.
37903647: Nicaragua's presidential election was deemed flawed and not free or fair by the US State Department, citing opposition candidate suppression and lack of international monitoring.
13291223: South Africa's government has announced plans to tackle "corrective rape" after 170,000 activists worldwide demanded action against the brutal practice targeting lesbians.
36052570: Oil-producing nations meet in Qatar to discuss production freeze, but its impact on current oversupply is uncertain amidst falling stocks and gloomy economic reports.
34944735: US biologists found that the vibrant blue color in tarantula species is not driven by sexual selection, but rather evolved independently multiple times due to its importance for visual signaling or camouflage.
32159602: The German prosecutors found internet searches on co-pilot Andreas Lubitz's tablet about ways to commit suicide and cockpit doors, suggesting he intentionally crashed Flight 9525.
34988915: Radio DJ Mr Fox denies eight counts of indecent assault and two counts of sexual assault between 1988 and 2014, claiming his behavior was consensual "horseplay" with colleagues.
37889203: Tottenham midfielder Dele Alli will miss upcoming international matches after twisting his knee in a clash with a teammate and being ruled out for "a few weeks".
33609927: A Jehovah's Witnesses elder was convicted of sexually abusing his niece and a family friend, but the organization's policy of requiring two witnesses to report abuse led to a delay in justice, and the abuser received no punishment from the church.
33578778: Greece's bailout program is expected to fail, according to former Finance Minister Yanis Varoufakis, who resigned earlier this month, citing a "greatest disaster of macroeconomic management ever".
36888270: The International Paralympic Committee (IPC) has opened proceedings against Russia's National Paralympic Committee over allegations of a widespread doping program, with a decision on any ban expected in August.
36846007: The Exiles rugby team signed 24-year-old Ben, a former England under-20 international, from Tottenham to bolster their squad ahead of a competitive season.
31723471: Manor F1 team has secured investment from Ovo boss Stephen Fitzpatrick and appointed former Sainsbury's CEO Justin King as interim chairman, aiming to be competitive at the highest level in the upcoming season.
15921828: The Welsh government has agreed on a £39m stimulus package to boost the economy, with funding for apprenticeships, school upgrades, and road improvements, but opposition parties have criticized its size and scope.
39109408: Former UK Prime Minister John Major warns that Brexit will be a "historic mistake" and urges the government to adopt a more diplomatic approach towards the EU, citing concerns over the impact on Northern Ireland's peace process and the UK's global influence.
20936833: The UK government is set to cap benefits at 1% for three years, despite opposition from Labour, which claims it will result in a real-terms cut in support for millions of working families.
36832879: A hole in a sewer under a railway track in Forest Hill has caused disruptions to Southern, Thameslink, and London Overground services until Wednesday, with repair work deemed "extremely complex".
14958201: City won 2-0 against Everton, breaking down the visitors' well-organised resistance with substitute Mario Balotelli's goal and James Milner's late finish, moving top of the Premier League ahead of Manchester United's visit to Stoke City.
34352262: Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon faced criticism over delayed patient discharges, with Labour claiming a target to reduce six-week delays had not been met in over three years despite her office insisting it had been achieved.
39805395: The European Court of Justice ruled that the UK's overflow pipes in a special conservation area broke clean water laws, but the UK will not be fined and must pay legal costs instead.
34303109: Pope Francis arrives in Cuba, hailing improving ties between the US and Cuba as an example of reconciliation, and urging further support for Cuban Catholics and a continued path of detente.
39939090: Rangi Chase, a 31-year-old half-back, has joined Widnes Vikings on loan from Castleford Tigers until the end of the season after being dropped due to an internal investigation.
29347771: Roddy Smith, Cricket Scotland's chief executive for 10 years, is leaving his post to seek a fresh challenge, citing the organization's growth and success during his tenure.
36783415: Sunderland's Sam Allardyce is a top contender for the England manager position despite being linked to FA vice-chairman David Gill in photographs.
37935687: Wales restored pride with a 35-25 win over Argentina, thanks to tries from Liam Williams and Gareth Davies, and Leigh Halfpenny's 14 points with the boot.
40260829: New Zealand troops stationed near Stonehenge carved a 130m-tall kiwi monument and created a scale model of the Battle of Messines, both now protected as scheduled monuments by Historic England.
36478199: Two prisoners at HMP Wayland were transferred to a higher security jail and face additional time after attempting to escape by grabbing keys from officers during an incident on May 27.
34541803: Tim Sherwood deserves more time as Aston Villa manager due to his ability to improve players and his experience as a captain and player, despite facing adversity in his first season at the club.
35360841: The Welsh Transport Minister proposes new measures to streamline and reduce fraud in the system, following concerns over rejected claims and suspended guidelines at one local council.
35550407: Men aged 65 can expect to live an additional 19 years, while women can expect to live 21 more years, but concerns arise over poor health among elderly people and regional disparities in life expectancy.
37561590: Operation Equinox is investigating claims of sexual, physical, and emotional abuse at Nottinghamshire council properties between the 1940s and 1990s, with 530 reported crimes confirmed on council property.
39328843: The FA Cup Women's quarterfinals have been drawn, featuring top-flight teams Chelsea, Manchester City, Liverpool, and Arsenal, along with promoted sides Sunderland and Bristol City.
